thread.title: Customers reveal their biggest online shopping fails | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Customers reveal their biggest online shopping fails | Daily Mail Online

author: Unity Blott For Mailonline
title: Customers reveal their biggest online shopping fails | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Too small: Instagrammer Nathan McCauley11 blasted: 'I think this company missed the mark on "Sized for large breed dogs" #onlineshoppingfail #onesizefitsmost' The pitfalls of autocorrect: Laura's 21st birthday cake wasn't quite what she expected after the bakery placed a 'blind girl' icing figurine on top instead of a 'blonde girl' Resourceful: Kaleisha Abby Crenshaw found a clever use for her too-small 'rug' after ordering the wrong size, using it as a bookmark instead JenBailey6 accidentally ordered a doll's house accessory, explaining: 'Ordered a new wooden cutting board that collects bread crumbs in the bottom... this is what came in the mail' Twitter user @JyeBurger was horrified to find his new phone case from Amazon appeared to have been defiled by a part of the male anatomy - leaving an unpleasant grease mark Adam Hess learned a valuable lesson after his bargain embroidered rug turned out to be the size of the palm of his hand. Next time he'll be sure to check out the small print 'Horrible and ill advertised': Matt took to Amazon to complain about a mug bought for his wife for Christmas which appeared to have been printed with the demo image in error At least it fits the teddy: Twitter user Dan was left in stitches after his mother ordered a Converse rucksack for her nephew online - which turned out to be doll-sized Quite the fashion statement: George Riggall was bemused after his '32in' Asos jeans appeared to have been designed for a giant rather than a normal person 'Any ideas how to attach it?' Twitter user Kelly was left rather red-faced after her 'fur wolf tail she bought for Halloween turned out to be something much ruder Pocked sized: BrendaBlancarte's roommate was another customer to mistake dollhouse accessories for actual furniture after receiving a miniature TV stand in the post Luckily Suzanne Bradish managed to see the funny side after Sainsbury's replaced her spring bouquet for a bunch of spring onions Read more:
